greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle by rows, generated from a triangle with (1,2,1,1,1,...) in every column.
comment: Sum of n-th row terms = rightmost term of next row.
formula: Let M = an infinite Toeplitz lower triangular matrix with (1,2,1,1,1,..) in
every column. A180262 = M * a diagonalized variant of A006356 such that
the main diagonal = A006356 prefaced with a 1: (1, 1, 3, 6, 14, 31,...) and the
example: First few rows of the triangle =
Example: row 3 of the triangle = (1, 1, 6, 6) = termwise products of
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Aug 21 2010
